instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D7701: What is D7701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.BKL_EN: What is BKL_EN? BKL_EN enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .
definitions.BLK_PWM: What is BLK_PWM? BLK_PWM is a typo of BKL_PWM. When you see BLK_PWM assume the poster meant to type BKL_PWM. BKL_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..
definitions.BKL_PWM: What is BKL_PWM? BKL_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Do you get image for sure?

Check XW7720 for continuity; lot of info available on the forum.
Inspect <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> for corrosion; pay atention to B1/2 balls.

threads.message:
i change u 7701 still the same, on <CAPACITOR>C8317</CAPACITOR> power is droping slowly from 19-8,5v any idea?
there is apple logo but no backlight

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
So backlight boosts and drops immediately.
Usually bad feedback trace, in this case.
Did you really check continuity from <DIODE>D7701</DIODE> and ball A5 of <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>?

Be sure all <RESISTOR>R7717</RESISTOR>-22 are good.
Check diode mode to ground on each one; should get very similar values.
Also test with known good LCD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: there is continuity <DIODE>D7701</DIODE> and A5 , <RESISTOR>R7717</RESISTOR>-22 are ok , i check on 2 lcd - the same ...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Post diode mode to ground on ALL <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> lines.
Use surrounding components as test points.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Seems that you didn't read "How To collection" thread.
Now take the red probe of your multimeter and keep it on the ground.
Check all test points ONLY with black probe!

BTW, use signal name, or component point; better to use <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> ball marked on schematic.
You are working one board at time; one pdf, one boardview.
I have approx 20 pdf schematics opened (for online support) and ONE boardview of the board I work on the desk.
Don't force me to open more; no need that, once pdf has all I need to reply.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Readings don't look bad.
Post <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL>/PWM voltage; with LCD connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Be sure <RESISTOR>R7704</RESISTOR> is good.
Do PRAM reset 2-3 times.
If <SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> still missing, is time to "force" it.
Remove <RESISTOR>R7704</RESISTOR> and run wire from <CAPACITOR>C7704</CAPACITOR> to <RESISTOR>R7715</RESISTOR>.

Sorry for delay; lost this thread somehow...
